p.span:
The SPEAKER ( Hon.
Tony Smith ) took the chair at 10:00, made an acknowledgement of country and read prayers.
DOCUMENTS

subdebateinfo.title: Agreement for Members to Contribute Remotely to Parliamentary Proceedings

p.span: Agreement for Members to Contribute Remotely to Parliamentary Proceedings
Presentation

Mr PORTER (Pearce—Attorney-General, Minister for Industrial Relations and Leader of the House) (10:01): by leave—I table an amended Agreement for Members to Contribute Remotely to Parliamentary Proceedings. I commence by thanking the Manager of Opposition Business for his agreement and assistance. This is a small modification, essentially, to allow the Prime Minister to attend and answer questions in question time today remotely, noting that the original draft of this agreement included that remote contributions were to occur at either electorate offices or Commonwealth parliamentary offices, of which The Lodge is neither. This amended arrangement will include The Lodge in that list.
COMMITTEES
Petitions Committee
Report
Mr O'DOWD (Flynn—Deputy Nationals Whip) (10:02): I present the 19th report of the Petitions Committee for the 46th Parliament.
PETITIONS
Mr O'DOWD (Flynn—Deputy Nationals Whip) (10:02): I present the following petitions:
Skilled Visas

We are applicants of Australian skilled visas (189/190/489/491,...), waiting for more than 8 months , the official disclosed duration. Generally, preparing documents for a skilled visa takes more than one year, followed by a long post-lodge waiting. In 2020, applicants are more stressful than ever, because the grants take longer time to hit the ground. Some applicants have experienced more than one year or even two. Due to the pandemic, the torment still last.

We respect the holistic configuration and strategy of the border control and the critical sector classification, as fully border opening definitely undermines the anti-covid triumph. And we also value our agreement BEFORE the pandemic happened. In some cases the primary applicant is onshore and secondary applicants are offshore, forcing them to live continents apart due to the delay in the visa process. What's worse, most will face the expiration of some documents, such as PCC, health check, language certificate. Redoing PCC, health check, and language certification is meaningless in most cases. It is completely avoidable if the regular processing restarts.

We want an immediate visa decision not out of the sheer goal of the job keeper or other welfare, instead we will make a long stay to boom the economy, diversify the culture and alleviate the ageing of population.
We therefore ask the House to release the offshore/onshore skilled visa grants lodged before the pandemic pending for more than 8 months.
From 186 citizens (EN1886)
Freedom of Information

I, Mr. Adrian Praljak, an Admitted Australian Lawyer in both; The Supreme Court of The Australian Capital Territory and in The High Court of Australia; respectfully ask the House to Take Urgent Action to help us Australian people obtain our Documents and Information from various; State and Federal Government Agencies in Australia.

In The State of Queensland, The Queensland Police Service (QPS), make RTI/FOI Applications too difficult for an; Individual or a Party; to satisfactorily comply with, in the majority of RTI/FOI Applications which are Filed with The QPS.
The QPS Actions; may amount to; Criminal behaviour, Corruption, Bias, Serious Conflict of Interests, Maladministration and other; Wrongs
We therefore ask the House to;

1. Request House Urgently please; Reform RTI/FOI Applications, Rules, Process, Timelines to Respond by an Agency to an Applicant, Criteria Standards of a Satisfactory Application made by an Australian Public Member, at both; State & Federal Government Levels.

2. Both State & Federal Agencies; makes the Application process and criteria; Too complex for the Australian Public and Individual person; to satisfactorily comply with and in many cases, there is; Serious Bias, Maladministration, Corruption, Serious Conflict Of Interests with various Parties, and State and Federal Agencies.
3. Some State & Federal Government Agencies; maybe doing this, to prevent people actually accessing their Lawful Right to their own Documents and Information.
4. Please House, take all other; Urgent "Positive Actions" and please update The Australian Public on all Positive House Actions taken moving forward.
Thank You
From 4 citizens (EN1950)
Media
Every media has been reduced for the expecprtion of the ABC & SBS WHY?
WHY DO WE NEED SO MANY RADIO ABC & SBS STATIONS ?
BOTH OF THEM ARE NOT SERVING THE AUSTRALIAN PUBLIC TO THEIR CHARTER.
ABC & SBS ARE ACTUALLY INCITING HATRED & DIVISON IN AUSTRALIA)
TELLING LIES & GOING AGAINST THE FEDERAL GOV. JUST BECAUSE THE ABC DO NOT LIKE THE GOV. OR THEIR POLICIES.
IT IS NO OF THE ABC OR SBS BUSINESS TO BE INVOLVED IN POLITICS OR RACE OR IDEOLOGICGAL POLITICS!
We therefore ask the House to IF THEY DO NOT FOLLOW THE ABC & SBS CHARTER WITHIN THE END OF THIS YEAR & GET OUT OF ANY LEFT WING ONLY POLITICS CUT ALL THEIR FUNDING & BE ONLY SUBSCRITION ONLY.
From 5 citizens (EN1955)
Energy
IF AUSTRALIA CAN SELL IT TO FOREIGNERS WE SHOULD BE ALLOWED TO USE COAL TOO.
THE GOV HAS TO FUND NEW COAL POWER & STOP SUBSIDIZING TOXIC SOLAR PANELS & KILLER WIND TIRBINES
PEOPLE OF AUSTRALIA CONTINUALLY REFUSE THE LABOR & GREENS LIEWS OF CLIMATE CHANGE & GREEN EXPENSIVE ONLY ENERGIES
We therefore ask the House toAUST. GIVE US A REFERNDUM NOW FOR USE OF COAL & FEDERAL GOV. TO BUILD NEW COAL POWER STATIONS IN ALL STATES OF AUSTRALIA
From 3 citizens (EN1957)
COVID 19: Yan, Dr Li-Meng

Dr. Li-meng Yan who is the Hong Kong virologist and Chinese Whistleblower, fled China to the United States to speak out the truth of COVID-19 and how the Chinese Communist Party (CCP)covers up the truth. After Dr Yan has been interviewed by many mainstream media, her mother was arrested by the CCP. She was targeted as a retaliation for Dr. Yan's bravery and efforts to save the world from the pandemic. The CCP has once again shown the world their evil.

We therefore ask the House to urge the Chinese government to release Dr Yan's mom. Australia as one of the Five Eyes Partner, also Australia has been one of the most early advocates of an independent investigation into the origins of this virus. We need to act together and bring justice to the world.
From 191 citizens (EN1958)
Leaders' Pledge for Nature

To set a clear mandate to shift away from fossil fuels, severely restrict the further destruction of natural areas and protect and rehabilitate damaged land for increased biodiversity, the Leaders' Pledge for Nature is an ambitious but achievable goal to set Australia on a path to environmental sustainability. The details of the pledge are clearly defined and signify the willingness of Australia to recognize that even a country as sparsely populated as ours needs to be conscious and dedicated to reducing its outsized impact on our planet. Upholding the diversity and sustainability of our boundless plains, waterways and atmosphere will drive a fundamental mindset shift in the way we provide clean air, food, water and power to Australians, whilst unlocking the exciting future potentials of low-impact development, tourism, prosperity, manufacturing and farming.

We therefore ask the House to join the other 76 countries worldwide to commit to stemming biodiversity loss and destruction of natural habitats by making and honouring this pledge. For the future biodiversity, sustainability and beauty of Australia and it's surrounding territories; and for the benefit of its people, indigenous and immigrant, resident and visitor.
From 8 citizens (EN1959)
Members of Parliament: Conduct

Politicians and political parties can mislead and deceive without consequence. Misleading parliament laws exist, applied only when parliamentarians knowingly present false information to Parliament. Convention previously resulted in resignation of Ministers when this occurred; this convention is no longer followed. Outside of Parliament, no rules exist. Voting occurs every 3 or 4 years, during this time, there are no consequences for dishonest behaviour. The vote is often between small options of dishonest candidates. This has resulted in lowering quality of elected candidates. New options are required to challenge deceptive behaviour within the courts. This would allow for evidence to be presented and assessed, outside of the brief slogans of the new cycle.

We therefore ask the House to create misleading and deceptive conduct laws, applying to politicians, their staffers and political parties. The laws should be formed to allow citizens to directly sue individuals or parties to seek damages where damage can be shown from any deceptive public conduct from these individuals or organisations. This will not eradicate dishonest behaviour but will provide a method for citizens to challenge dishonesty within the public debate within the courts. The laws should include the ability to sue politicians, their staffers and their political parties for not correcting the record when they notice dishonest conduct within their ranks. This will provide a greater incentive for individuals to publicly dispute dishonest behaviour within their own party to avoid potential lawsuits from citizens. This creates competitive self-interest among those seeking to deceive the public.
From 5 citizens (EN1960)
COVID-19: International Travel

Immediate Family of Australian Citizen and Permanent Residents must include Parents and Siblings to be granted travel exemption to visit Australia. We immigrants, have no one to support at this time of pandemic. Where domestic violence and very limited social support is available. This can include voluntary quarantine plan, booked in advance prior arrival.

We therefore ask the House to include "Immediate Family" of Australian Citizen and Permanent Residents, Parents and Siblings to be granted 'travel exemption' to visit Australia. We immigrants, have no one to support at this time of pandemic. Where domestic violence and very limited social support is available. This can include voluntary quarantine plan, booked in advance prior arrival.
From 16166 citizens (EN1964)
Banking and Financial Services

The Financial sunset law that allows defaulters to avoid financial liabilities after 6 years is favouring the crooks and unfairly disadvantage groups of simple Australians who are either ignorant or less informed about the financial injustices incurred on them. Money has value always even after 6 years hence this Age Old unjust Law needs to be considered for abolition in the modern Digital Financial Systems and continue to provide Justice to the Cheated Australians

We therefore ask the House to I would like to request the Honourable representatives of the Australian Citizens to Abolition this unfair Law that favours the crooks and punish the cheated people of Australia financially
From 60 citizens (EN1966)
Child Care
Childcare is more than care, it is education.

The first few years of a child's life presents the greatest opportunity to develop positive social skills and resilience. The long term social and economic benefits of early childhood learning have been proven to lead to less long term reliance on welfare and a lower crime rate. Participants in high-quality early childhood education show lower rates of incarceration (46% reduction), lower rates of arrest for violent crimes (33% reduction), and less likely to have received government assistance (26% reduction).
Early childhood education reduces grade retention and is shown to save school systems money.
Investments in high-quality early childhood education can generate up to $7.30 per dollar invested.
However, since this benefit is not realised within a sitting government's term, the incentive for a sitting government to act on this is low.
Having said that, he immediate economic benefits include allowing parents to improve their labor productivity by increasing work hours, missing fewer work days, and pursuing further education.
The availability of early childhood education programs attracts homebuyers and increases property values by $13.00 for every dollar invested in local programs.
This is analogous to a direct stimulus package, but with an added investment in this country's future generation.
This is an obvious move and should be supported by the current government.
We therefore ask the House to reinstate a full childcare subsidy for all Australians.
From 20 citizens (EN1967)
Media
EN1938 a petition to raise a Royal Commission to ensure a strong and diverse Australian News Media.
We therefore ask the House to appoint such a Royal Commision
From 108 citizens (EN1968)
Battery Recycling

I request that all Lithium Ion battery sellers (Mobile phone manufacturers, Garden Tools, Electric Cars etc) are required by law to have a battery return program in which they are legally required to take return of faulty or failed batteries outside of the warranty period.

We therefore ask the House to as part of the 250 million recycling program announcement as part of the 2020/21 budget that they enact a law in parliament restricting the sale of Lithium Ion batteries unless the manufacturer or resale provider has adequate means to provide a battery return program.
From 15 citizens (EN1974)
Energy

WHT ARE WE CONTINUALLY DESTROYING AUSTRALIA & DENYING AUSTRALIANS CHEAP ELECTRICITY WHILE AUSTRALIANS ARE NOT ALLOWED TO BUILD NEW COAL POWER STAIONS BUT FEDERAL GOV. IS ALLOWING FOREIGN COUNTRIES TO BUY IT FROM US.
We therefore ask the House to REFENDUM NOW ON ALLOWING TO BUILD NEW LOW EMISSIONS COAL POWER IN ALL STATES & USE OUR AUSTRALIAN COAL.
STOP SUBSIDIZING TOXIC SOLAR PANELS & KILLER WIND TURBINE
STOP BEING PART OF THE AUSTRALIAN PEOPLE NON ELECTED PARIS AGREMENT & UNITED NATION & WORLD ECONMOIC FORUM & THE GREAT RESET
From 3 citizens (EN1975)

subdebateinfo.title: Aged Care, National Disability Insurance Scheme

p.span: Aged Care
National Disability Insurance Scheme
WHY SHOULD WE ALL FUND THIS WHILE NOT FUND FULLY THE AGED CARE OR THE AGED PENSION?
We therefore ask the House to STOP FULL FUNDING OF THE NDIS NOW
From 2 citizens (EN1976)
COVID-19: Visitor Visas

Many international visitors with Visitor (subclass 600) visa who arrived in Australia just before the start of the Covid-19 pandemic and can't return to their home country are in the fear of being made into illegal immigrants due to the rigidly unforgiving visa rules.

My own parents are in this helpless group of people. Their return flights at the end of February this year were cancelled and the possibility of obtaining replacement flights has been unclear even until today. Consequently, they are forced to renew their visa continuously.

However, the increasingly expensive visa application fee and the nearly impossible requirement of presenting a police certificate from their home country are removing their last resort to stay in this country lawfully. As the world is still undergoing the second wave of the pandemic and the vaccine is still not on the horizon, this compelling visa issue has transpired into a human crisis.
We therefore ask the House to extend temporarily the length of stay for Visitor (subclass 600) visas to the official end date of COVID-19 pandemic.
From 26 citizens (EN1978)
Media

As an Australian citizen, I demand a royal commission into the monopoly of the Murdock press here in Australia. The lies & misinformation has become an utter disgrace & and an unfair representation of the correct facts. This work has had an unfair influence on our elections for many years. The corruption by multi- millionaires with massive advertising is not what we, citizens of Australia want or will put up with any longer. An utter disgrace & bad reflection on our beautiful country. Please put a stop to this monopoly & we can do so much better than this rubbish here in Australia. Thank you Karen Foote
We therefore ask the House to request the House of Representatives act on this petition
From 516 citizens (EN1980)
Members of Parliament: Conduct

In 2019 the Senate passed a bill for the creation of an effective anti-corruption watchdog. The current Government will not bring a bill before the House of Representatives, the delays must end. We need independent oversight of our politicians, and the decisions they make, because our democracy is suffering and the public perception of politician trustworthiness and integrity is at an all time low, especially among young people. The political donation system is woefully inadequate and does not ensure public interests take the forefront during decision making. The donation rules need to be improved. This petition calls on the Government to prove their integrity as soon as possible and restore some faith in the Australian Democracy by creating an independent watchdog with the power to get to the bottom of every scandal, improve the donation system, and ensure our elected representatives are accountable for their actions.

We therefore ask the House to immediately create an effective independent watchdog with the power to get to the bottom of every questionable act, improve the donation system and ensure our elected representatives are accountable for their actions.
From 217 citizens (EN1982)
Tobacco Regulation
The Australian government wants to have people require a script for smoking and they want to change so that chemists sell then
Other Plans the Australian government have is
Stop the sales to people born after a certain year
And reducing the amount of tobacco retailers as well as stop the supply of smokes to certain retailers
We therefore ask the House to Scrap the anti-smoking campaign that will change to having a script needed or going to a chemist
From 19 citizens (EN1984)
Tobacco Regulation

Stop the yearly tax increase of 12.5 per cent each year , it was only supposed to short term, and is now unfairly punishing Smokers esp those of lower Socio economic backgrounds. Disabled, people with mental health, the most disadvataged of the community..etc ...It's cruel and unfair and unjust.

People don't smoke because they can afford it — they smoke because they don't want to stop. That's why, despite the astronomic cost of cigarettes, smoking rates in Australia remain comparable to the rest of the developed world.
We therefore ask the House to stop the annual increase in taxes on smoke's
Because

It is unhelpful, even immoral, to keep jacking up the price of cigarettes. As well as imposing immense financial strain for vulnerable people, high cigarette prices encourage people to turn to the black market, and fund organised crime. We shouldn't further disadvantage people whose disadvantage drives them to smoke. Charging pack-a-day smokers in excess of $16,000 a year isn't the answer. If we want to stop the causes of smoking, lowering the price of cigarettes might actually be a good place to start.
From 39 citizens (EN1987)
COVID-19: International Travel

Australian Citizens are being denied their right to return to Australia, violating the Universal Declaration of Human Rights. The arrivals cap on people entering Australia is forcing Australians to become stateless or into forced exile. Over 100,000 are stranded overseas.

The suffering for these stranded Australians is inhumane. Flights cancelled with little notice, leaving many homeless, living in airports. Many have young children including newborns. With mental health stretched to extremes, it's only a matter of time before someone self-harms. Australia's governments, while ignoring the plight of Australian Citizens, is making every effort to bring in foreigners such as sportspeople, students and fruit-pickers.

Prior to the cap being implemented, the quarantine system was able to cope with higher arrival numbers. The quarantine breakdown in Victoria was due to state based issues. Other states did not have outbreaks at that time.

Many methods including home quarantine, have been used effectively by other countries to keep the local population safe while allowing citizens to return. In addition, the way cap numbers are calculated is absurd, for example, a baby not requiring a 'seat' is still counted into the cap. The numbers of rooms used for hotel quarantine is actually much less than the headline numbers. Victoria's airport and hotels are idle.
We therefore ask the House to immediately allow Australians to return to Australia:
Remove caps on arriving travellers.
Implement other quarantine measures such as home quarantine (with associated compliance measures).
Restart hotel quarantine in Victoria if hotel quarantine continues.
From 646 citizens (EN1988)
Telecommunications
Inclusion of Flagstone 4280 in the Mobile Blackspot Program

Greater Flagstone is located in Logan City Council and within the Federal Electorate of Wright in Queensland and was classified as a Priority Development Area by the Queensland Government in 2010. The Greater Flagstone Area has grown in population 150 residents in 1997 to more than 5902 residents in 2019. With new PDA developments meant to encourage new residents to move to the area, the Government is spruiking that we have reliable internet coverage, however the current towers are not in appropriate spots to provide access to the majority of the area.
We therefore ask the House to include the postcode of 4280 in the next Mobile Blackspot Program

Residents inform the House that services offered by providers are intermittent / sporadic and at times non-existent with numerous blackspots recorded. Residents need mobile coverage for physical health and safety, to operate their businesses, for internet use at home and educational use at local schools. Petitioners believe a mobile tower located at the new retail district or raising the current towers, may alleviate some of the issues surrounding blackspot issues within the Greater Flagstone community.

The attached petitioners are calling on the House of Representatives to prioritise Flagstone 4280 into the next Round of the Mobile Blackspot Program which will allocate funding to regional and rural areas.
From 133 citizens (EN1991)
Telecommunications
This Petition is for residents of Woorinen and District, Victoria and draws to the attention of the Speaker and the House, the lack of mobile phone and internet reception within the Woorinen area.

The township and district of Woorinen is not in an isolated rural location but approximately 13km from the major centre of Swan Hill Victoria. Despite Woorinen & District being close to a major township the residents are subjected to unreliable and sometime non-existent internet and phone coverage.

The Woorinen region is home to one of the most productive and economical stone fruit growing regions in Australia, however residents and business owners cannot take a phone call inside their homes or packing facilities. The area exports fruit around the world, delivers to every state in Australia, yet are expected to operate with substandard internet speeds and almost non-existent mobile reception. The lack of reliable phone and internet impedes business success, restricts opportunities, disadvantages school children and hinders basic communication between family and friends.

Reliable internet and phone coverage is something the vast majority of Australian residents are able to take for granted and we (the undersigned) strongly believe that the residents of Woorinen and district should not be disadvantaged by poor internet and phone coverage within their area.
We therefore ask the House to urgently address this issue and have reliable internet and phone reception connected within Woorinen and District
From 471 citizens (EN1993)
COVID-19: International Travel
To, The House of Representatives,
As Australians, We would like to highlight the issues faced by Temporary Residents stranded overseas due to COVID 19.

All Temporary Residents including skilled-workers, graduates, and students have been an integral part of the Australian community. Their contribution to the economy includes and is not limited to paying international student tuition fees, visa fees, supporting local economy and working in skilled areas.
At the time of humanitarian need when Australia was hurt with bush fires, many of these Temporary residents have voluntarily helped out the community.

As of today, there are thousands of Temporary residents stuck overseas, eagerly waiting to resume their lives in Australia. Many have lost or are on verge of losing their jobs, their savings, and their visa times. As they have standing responsibilities in Australia, they are still paying rents and bills, and are finding it extremely hard to support themselves overseas. The amount of time, efforts, and money that have been spent from their side - will soon amount to nothing.
We therefore ask the House to
1.Extend all their visas for up to 5 years so when they come back to Australia would have enough time to make up and get back on track with their personal and professional lives.

2.Provide Permanent Residency pathway as a special COVID-19 consideration to all the Temporary Residents mentioned above so Australia can retain this skilled workforce and together to take Australia forward and make it the best country in the world.
From 347 citizens (EN1994)
Climate Change

In a study published in Environmental Research Letters, the authors found that the greatest effect one can have on mitigating climate change is by having one fewer child. According to the study from Lund University in Sweden, having one fewer child equates to a reduction of 58 tonnes of carbon dioxide for each year of a parent's life, however Australians' emissions are currently sitting at 16 tonnes per person per annum. According to economist Sir Nicholas Stern, we need to reduce anthropogenic emissions to two tonnes per person annually if we are to avoid a global average temperature rise above 2 degrees Celsius by 2050.
Irrespective of these findings, it is evident that Australia (and the world) is immensely overpopulated, as ecologists studying biodiversity have noted.

We therefore ask the House to implement a progressive procreation tax. Such a tax would increase proportionate to the number of children a person has. Ideally, revenue from such a tax would be used to fund green initiatives, including renewable energy, ecosystem restoration and electric vehicle networks.
From 4 citizens (EN1995)
International Development Assistance

According to World Visions, the average Australian believes that 16% of the Federal Budget is allocated to overseas aid, whilst also believing that the figure should be reduced to roughly 12%. In reality, Australia spends only $4.044 billion in overseas aid -- or 0.21% of our gross national income. In comparison, Great Britain contributes 0.7% of GNI to foreign aid, Sweden 1.1% and Germany 0.65%. We need to do much more.

It has been widely recognised that family planning provides many benefits, including: improving educational outcomes for women, increasing per capita wealth, and reducing environmental harm. Given that the world is massively overpopulated, more money must be allocated to reputable family planning organisations overseas such as Marie Stopes and Population Services International.
Women in developing nations must be provided with the educational tools and autonomy to make an informed decision as to whether or not they want to reproduce.
We therefore ask the House to substantially increase foreign aid to reputable family planning organisations
From 2 citizens (EN1996)
Gambling

Video game companies avoid predatory Loot Boxes being defined as gambling on the technicality items received can't be redeemed for money despite clearly being gambling otherwise. Update the Gambling Act to include purchases providing randomized digital items even if they do not have monetary value.

Please note action has been taken in Blelguim to ban the in-game monetary purchases, and currently the UK Government are looking at reviewing and revising it Gambling laws after a petition of 46,627 was submitted.

We therefore ask the House to expand the Gambling Act to cover Video Game in-game purchases. The young and the vulnerable appear to be the most lured in by this and are throwing away money year on year for an in-game item that is based on luck, and 99% of the time they do not get what they paid for. There needs to be a presidence set to Video game companies that are using this tactic.
From 13 citizens (EN1997)
Samoa: Human Rights

1. The Joint Parliamentary Committee on Human Rights may examine Acts for compatibility with human rights, and report to both Houses of the Parliament under section 7(b) of the Human Rights (Parliamentary Scrutiny) Act 2011.
2. Samoa has made a request for the extradition of an Australian citizen ("the Aussie").
3. The Aussie was within Australian territory at all times material to the conduct alleged to constitute an offence in Samoa.
4. The Aussie has never been charged or questioned by Australian law enforcement authorities in respect of the alleged conduct.

5. On 20th August 2020 the Aussie was arrested by Australian Federal Police on an extradition arrest warrant issued by an Australian Magistrate pursuant to section 12 of the Extradition Act 1988 ("the Extradition Act") and has been held in custody since that date.
6. Samoa is not required to provide evidence in support of its allegations.

7. The person to whom the proceedings relate is not entitled to adduce, and the magistrate or Judge is not entitled to receive, evidence to contradict an allegation that the person has engaged in conduct constituting an extradition offence for which the surrender of the person is sought.

We therefore ask the House to refer this petition to Joint Parliamentary Committee on Human Rights for inquiry and report in respect of the operation of the Extradition Act 1988 for compatibility with human rights; review the grant of no-evidence status to extradition requests from Samoa ; and revoke the Extradition (Samoa) Regulations 2010.
From 127 citizens (EN2000)
Economy

The Australian economy has been built on both strong public and private sectors. They have complimented each other and the system has worked well. My concern is that we are diminishing our public owned entities and expanding the private ones. I would like to see a royal commission into the privatising of our public assets to make sure that a safe balance of public and private entities exist. It has been shown that some entities work well as private companies and some don't. From recent experience some public hospitals that have been run by private companies have not worked. It also appears that looking after our elderly by the private sector has not been a great success as shown by the number of recent deaths in aged care. Banks appear to work as private companies as do private hospitals and toll road companies. Our precious water also seems to be having trouble in private hands. Assets such as water, I believe should remain public. I am not expert enough to be able to decide which of these entities should be private or public so I am calling on the government to hold a royal commission to establish a correct ratio of public to private that benefits the whole country and all of its people.

We therefore ask the House to support the establishment of a Royal Commission to ensure that the correct ratio of public to private entities exist in Australia to benefit our land and all of its people.
From 9 citizens (EN2001)
Climate Change
Requesting that the house will act on climate change and lower Australia's emissions to zero by 2030.

We therefore ask the House to recognise that you have a duty to future generations of Australians and need to do all you can to stop climate change and do all they can to lower Australia's emissions to zero 2030.
From 34 citizens (EN2002)
Mental Health: Youth

The social discourse that surrounds todays youth has become increasingly convoluted and radicalised, due to factors such as the internet and social media. One such example is a phenomenon coined 'Big Chungus', which appears to be a malicious and deliberately harmful code used to radicalise the mentally ill. While the broader social impact of social media remains to be seen, the government should be taking an active role in monitoring such social media phenomenons like 'Big Chungus', to ensure that this generation isn't being negatively impacted.

We therefore ask the House to investigate the effects of social media phenomenon such as 'Big Chungus', and to determine whether the establishment of a Royal Commission is necessary to protect todays youth.
From 13 citizens (EN2003)
Human Rights: Thailand

Thailand, following the military coup in 2014, has systematically repressed information and imposed martial law on its citizens. Australia is in a unique position to influence this, as the current King of Thailand was educated here; and in South East Asia, Australia has a degree of influence. The actions that the government is taking upon Thai citizens, including the banning of websites like 'change.org' to prevent petitions being made regarding this issue, and the violent brutality inflicted by the police, is abhorrent. As a democracy, Australia is obligated to protect basic human rights of all peoples, not only our own.

We therefore ask the House to publically and formally condemn the actions taken by the Thai government against it's people. We cannot, in good conscience, allow such gross violations of human rights to go unnoticed and unchallenged.
From 44 citizens (EN2005)
Climate Change

Government must end fossil fuels and transition to renewables as a matter of priority. We will continue to face unprecedented and extreme weather events caused by the collapse of our ecosystems. We call on the government to provide a Universal Basic Income to allow for the most rapid and flexible response possible.

We therefore ask the House to immediately divest from fossil fuels and implement a Universal Basic Income for all citizens. This will allow rapid mobilisation of workforce support wherever needed, while mitigating some of the worst aspects of the economic collapse following catastrophic climate events. It will also provide much needed security for those badly affected by and vulnerable to the inevitable disruption that is coming.
From 19 citizens (EN2007)
Australian Public Service
ACT has become a privlidge self centered few set of public servants & do not now understand what is happening in other States of Australia
We therefore ask the House to move many of the public services to other States NOT JUST CANBBERA.
From 1 citizen (EN2008)
COVID-19: Lockdowns
THE LOCKDOWNS ARE NO LOGER ABOUT HEATH BUT IT HAS BECOME POLITICAL & DICTATORIAL NOT THE DEMOCRATIC COUNTRY WE ARE SUPPOSED TO BE.
THERE IS ANGER & DESPAIR .
IT NOT GOOD FOR PEACE OR ORDER IN OUR STATES OF AUSTRALIA.
We therefore ask the House to USE THE AUSTRALIAN CONSTITUTION SECTIONS 51 & 92
REMOVE THE POWERS OF THE STATES NOW
Legislative powers of the Parliament
The Parliament shall, subject to this Constitution, have power to make laws for the peace, order, and good government of the Commonwealth
There is no peace or oreder or any good Gov Iin the States of Australia, espcially Victoria.
From 19 citizens (EN2009)
Parliament
If elected for any political party they should NOT be allowed to transfer or joing another party unless they want to go to a by election at their own expense
We therefore ask the House to any STOP elected MP of any political party to move/join another party or be independant without by-election of their own expense
From 5 citizens (EN2011)
Environment

The use of toxic and non bio degradable plastics in Australia has had a devastating and severe detrimental affect of the land, seas/oceans and all living beings. The plastics that are currently being used are poisoning the earth and all living beings. Our sea/ocean life are living amongst an absolutely astonishing amount of plastics and are ingesting these plastics on a daily basis which is poisoning, suffocating and killing them. Our land fill is at a ridiculous state and cannot continue to be filled with plastics that do not degrade and break down, these plastics are toxic and leak this toxicity. The use of these plastics needs to stop or we will be at a place of no return, the Ban of these plastics will stop this cycle and then we can clean and clear what we do have in a more productive and environmentally friendly way. Switching to other natural materials and non toxic bio degradable plastics is the answer to this problem and our focus on practices for rehabilitation and rejuvenation will repair what has already been done.

We therefore ask the House to take action to Ban the use, sale, import and export of all toxic non bio degradable plastics in Australia and to use and promote other plant based sustainable natural materials and non toxic bio degradable plastics.
From 247 citizens (EN2014)
General Practice
People in our community cannot afford to see a doctor and their health is suffering. They are unable to afford the fee for a consultation in the local clinic.

Whilst patients can receive their Medicare rebate in seconds, the local clinic waits weeks, even months for their rebate, with Medicare sending the payment via patients in the form of a cheque. The clinic is therefore unable to offer the gap only payment to its patients due to the financial burden the payment delay places on them.
Improving the gap payment process for GP clinics will allow the local clinic to provide a more affordable service to the community, which will deliver better health outcomes.
We therefore ask the House to improve the gap payment process for GP clinics to ensure timely delivery of rebates to allow clinics to offer affordable services in their communities.
From 17 citizens (EN2017)
Commonwealth Integrity Commission

A Federal CIC was announced on 13 December 2018. The House should consult, draft legislation and submit for public consultation within an acceptable timeframe. The ICAC In NSW is a clear example of why need a similar body at the Federal level. It is clear from the 'sportsrorts' scandal, donating $40 million over four years to Rupert Murdoch (Newscorp) without tender as well as water, oil, gas, mining, 'cash for visas', housing and health portfolios that we need a Federal ICAC.

If the House and its members act in a negligent manner they must be held accountable. Ministers should not use their positions of power to influence or be influenced by private businesses. Taxpayers should have a right to ensure the House and its members are acting in a lawful and just way to ensure Australia's democracy represents everything it was established for.

COVID19 is not an excuse as to why legislation has not been introduced. The House and its members should be capable of multitasking. The House has a responsibility to Australian taxpayers to ensure public money is being used legally. Fear of an ICAC is the very reason why we need one.
We therefore ask the House to draft legislation of a Federal ICAC or CIC and release it for public consultation by March 20, 2021.
From 143 citizens (EN2019)
China: Human Rights
Australians are travelling to China and paying for organs on demand in order to have organ transplants.

The People's Republic of China (PRC) has been forcibly harvesting organs from people for decades. Innocent people are murdered to order so that organs (kidneys, livers, hearts, lungs, corneas, skin) can be procured as commodities for sale. People deemed a threat to the Chinese Communist Party (CCP) because of their beliefs, ethnicity, culture or religion are declared enemies of the state and imprisoned.

From 1999, the CCP had systematised the persecution of people who practice Falun Gong, a form of Buddhist meditation practice cultivating qualities of truthfulness, compassion and tolerance. Practitioners numbered over 70 million. A secret extrajudicial unit, the 610 Office, was established by the Chinese government to eradicate Falun Gong. Over the subsequent years, forced live organ harvesting has grown into a multi-billion dollar industry in China. Other victims to these horrors include entire ethnic groups such as the Uyghurs. Organs have been harvested from people while awake without any anaesthetics.

We therefore ask the House to 1) criminalise commercial transactions of organ transplantation with sanctions to apply to those that facilitate such transactions as well as the recipient of such organs, 2) mandate a nation-wide register of transplant recipients requiring the provenance of transplanted organs, 3) make it a criminal offence for an Australian citizen to obtain an organ transplant in the PRC, and 4) denounce the ongoing atrocities in the PRC with respect to forced live organ harvesting.

PETITIONS
Responses
Mr O'DOWD (Flynn—Deputy Nationals Whip) (10:02): I present the following ministerial responses to petitions previously presented:
Bill of Rights
Dear Chair
I refer to your email of 10 February 2020 and your letter of 23 September 2020 regarding petition number EN1144, which requests that the House pass the Australian Bill of Rights Bill 2019.
I appreciate the time you have taken to bring this petition to my attention and apologise for the delay in responding.

The Government considers that existing mechanisms to protect and promote human rights, including the protections in place under anti-discrimination legislation at the Commonwealth, state and territory levels, are appropriate. On this basis, the Government does not propose to introduce a charter or bill of rights at the federal level.
Thank you for raising this matter with me.
Yours sincerely
from the Minister for Industrial Relations, Mr Porter
